main event: An object resembling a star was sighted in Utica, New York for approximately 40 minutes on December 27, 1955.
interesting points: The object was round and stationary for the first 30 minutes before turning bright red and then disappearing., The sighting lasted from 11:10 to 11:45 GMT., The observer was traveling on the New York State Thruway and sighted the object while driving., The object was reported to have been luminous and changed color during the sighting., The witness was a 28-year-old cost estimator with previous military experience.
witness description: One male observer aged 28 and one female observer aged 32, both from Syracuse, New York.
